description: Borrowed from Japanese 切腹 (seppuku), from Middle Chinese 切 (t͡set, “to cut”) +‎ 腹 (pjuwk, “belly”). Compare Cantonese 切腹 (tsit-fuk) and Mandarin 切腹 (qiēfù).

nouns.description: seppuku (countable and uncountable, plural seppukus or seppuku)

entries.meaning: A form of ritual suicide by disembowelment using a blade, practiced by Japanese samurai, especially to rid oneself of shame, as a means of protest, or, formerly, as a method of capital punishment.
